abstract: United Nations war crimes tribunal for Yugoslavia releases French journalist Florence Hartmann from prison in The Hague, normally reserved for war crimes suspects and convicts, amid outcry from rights activists; Hartmann was arrested near court for failure to pay fine in 2009, following accusations that she illegally published confidential decisions.

headline.print_headline: Tribunal Releases Journalist Held 5 Days in a Prison for War Criminals
headline.main: Tribunal Releases Journalist Held 5 Days in a Prison for War Criminals

snippet: Florence Hartmann, from France, was held on a 2009 warrant for contempt of court, for writing about the confidential workings of tribunal judges.
lead_paragraph: Florence Hartmann, from France, was held on a 2009 warrant for contempt of court, for writing about the confidential workings of tribunal judges.
